thread.title: Everyone’s chasing West Delaware in the Wamac

title: Everyone’s chasing West Delaware in the Wamac
text:
Everyone's chasing West Delaware in the Wamac Everyone's chasing West Delaware in the Wamac Volleyball: 4A top-ranked Hawks lead 7 other title hopefuls at Marion Gazette , Iowa Prep Sports , Prep Sports , Prep Volleyball , Preps Etc. By Jeff Linder , Sports , Sports Rotator , Photos West Delaware’s Addison Brooks (left) and Carlee Ketchum celebrate a point during last year’s state volleyball tournament. The Hawks are favored at the Wamac Conference tournament Tuesday at Marion. (Jim Slosiarek/The Gazette) Iowa Football Data Center 
I've covered Iowa football at The Gazette since 1999 Sunday October 18, 2015 
Columnist giving commentary and information about sports in Iowa. Monday October 19, 2015 
Your source for Iowa sports and more. Sunday October 18, 2015 
Covering Iowa State and central Iowa for Eastern Iowa Sunday October 18, 2015 
Kernels baseball, RoughRiders hockey and a lot of things in between. Saturday October 17, 2015 
I cover high school sports and Iowa women's basketball. Monday October 19, 2015 
Your source for all things auto racing in Eastern Iowa. Wednesday September 23, 2015 
Sharing community and high school contributed stories Friday October 16, 2015 October 19, 2015 | 12:22 pm 
MARION — What’s it going to take? According to Maggie Willems, quite a bit. 
“To play with West Delaware, you really have to play a near-perfect match,” said Willems, the volleyball coach at Mount Vernon. “The longer the match goes, the better they seem to get. Their setter (Carlee Ketchum) is wicked smart. So you have to play 25 points of nearly flawless volleyball to have a chance.” 
Class 4A top-ranked West Delaware (41-2) is the favorite as the Wamac Conference tournament moves to bracket play Tuesday at Marion High School. 
All 16 Wamac teams will congregate at Marion, including eight in the championship bracket. Action starts at 4 p.m. 
West Delaware won its pool Thursday, as did 3A No. 5 Mount Vernon (22-11), 4A No. 5 Marion (26-7) and 4A No. 13 Western Dubuque (20-11). 
The Mustangs tripped 3A No. 6 Center Point-Urbana (27-6), which will face West Delaware in a quarterfinal match at 5 p.m. 
“That was an important win for us,” Willems said. “We’ve been battling injuries, so it’s remarkable how we have responded.” 
The Wamac sent five teams to the state tournament last year. West Delaware was the 4A runner-up, and Solon beat Mount Vernon in the 3A final. If the league is down from that lofty perch this fall, it’s not by much. 
“CPU and Western Dubuque have gotten a lot better. They both have great size,” Willems said. “Marion is great, they have size and experience. 
“We feel good. We feel confident. We’re getting better at the right time of the year.” 
Mount Vernon faces Clear Creek Amana (23-14) at 4 p.m. in the first round. Western Dubuque faces Dyersville Beckman (15-17) at 4; Marion meets Independence (20-12) at 5. 
Semifinals are scheduled for 6:30, the championship at 7:15. 
POSTSEASON BEGINS IN 1A, 2A 
Regionals begin Tuesday in Class 2A and Class 1A, with a pair of area ranked teams in action. 
North Cedar (26-9), the 14th-ranked team in 2A, hosts Bellevue (3-18) at Clarence. Class 1A No. 9 Iowa Valley (22-8), the South Iowa Cedar League champion, faces Lynnville-Sully (10-8) at Marengo. 
Both matches begin at 7 p.m. 
Among area teams with first-round byes are 2A No. 4 West Branch and 1A No. 5 Springville. Both begin their postseason run next Tuesday. 
Regionals kick off next Monday in 3A, 4A and 5A. 
WAMAC CONFERENCE TOURNAMENT 
Tuesday, at Marion High School 
Quarterfinals 
West Delaware (41-2) vs. Center Point-Urbana (27-6), 5 p.m. 
Mount Vernon (22-11) vs. Clear Creek Amana (23-14), 4 p.m. 
Western Dubuque (20-11) vs. Dyersville Beckman (15-17), 4 p.m. 
Marion (26-7) vs. Independence (20-12), 5 p.m. 
Semifinals
